Applied patch by joe.bowbeer, issue #150 .Reported by joe.bowbeer, Sep 27, 2008The compiler generates a lot of unchecked warnings when openintents iscompiled with -Xlint:unchecked.A patch to revision 1110 for SDK 1.0 r1 is attached.The patch fixes a number of other problems, of varying severity:1. NPE in MediaBrowserActivity when browsing images or video:mLayoutID may not be initialized in some cases.2. Fixed exception in TagsCloudView onListItemClick.3. Removed unused imports.4. Added missing "@Override" annotations.5. Replaced Collection implementations with interfaces where possible. Refactored the main intents in order to use permissions.Now, to use any of the intents: get/set encrypt/decrypt, you will needto declare use of a permission as follows:    <uses-permission android:name="org.openintents.safe.ACCESS_INTENTS" />I've made that change to TestSafe and Notepad.This required refactoring the FrontDoor.  Basically, I moved _all_ thefunctionality of FrontDoor to a new class: IntentHandler, and changedthe name of that class. Now FrontDoor basically only:    if (action == null || action.equals(Intent.ACTION_MAIN)){          Intent i = new Intent(getApplicationContext(),          IntentHandler.class);          startActivity(i);    }Now FrontDoor only handles those actions as above, and IntentHandlerhandles all the others, and includes the permission:   <activity class=".IntentHandler" android:name="IntentHandler"android:label="@string/app_name"              android:permission="org.openintents.safe.ACCESS_INTENTS">Please see the OI Safe Manifest file for details.This was required because the launcher would need to use thatpermission if it protected ACTION_MAIN!  So now the launcher isallowed to run FrontDoor (which requires no permission) and FrontDoorruns IntentHandler.  Basically this goes around the permission in thecase of action MAIN. Modified : /trunk/NotePad/AndroidManifest.xml Modified : /trunk/Safe/AndroidManifest.xml Modified : /trunk/Safe/res/values/strings.xml Added : /trunk/Safe/src/org/openintents/safe/IntentHandler.java Modified : /trunk/UpdateChecker/src/org/openintents/updatechecker/Manifest.java Modified : /trunk/samples/TestSafe/AndroidManifest.xml

OI Safe: moved almost all access of the database to a new class Passwords.This new class in turn interacts with DBHelper.   It retains allPassEntry and CategoryEntry data in memory.  Encrypted data is onlydecrypted as needed.   Decrypted data is kept in memory.  This servesas a cache and results in a dramatic increase in speed on theCategoryList and PassList activities upon repeat use.All references to DBHelper for passwords or categories have beenremoved from all activities and centralized inside of Passwords.  Theonly remaining DBHelper calls are for the Salt and MasterPassword.With this new class we should be able to more easily implement asearch activity.Fixed an assortment of minor flaws surround orientation changes.Possibly fixed I210.  Fixed I206 and I209.This is a major overhaul.  Please help test for new bugs. SensorDemo: Apply patch by Daniel Wikman.Updates:AndroidManifest.xml: Changed: VIEW -> EDIT, since I needed the Settings dialog to come up first, Otherwise I could not connect. Needed? Well maybe no, if the SensorSimulatorSettings is updated accordingly so that can be run first from a separate app. Added: minSdkVersion tag which removes the "warning" when starting it.SensorManagerSimulator.java: Changed: Made a singleton out of it, I cannot see why multiple instances would be required in an app. Added: Method to detect whether to try to connect to the real SensorManager. Added: Toast message to alert that real sensors are unavailable. Changed: Added lots of checks whether the real sensor manager is present.SensorManagerSettingsActivity.java: Changed: now uses singleton method to obtain SensorManagerSimulator.SensorSimulatorClient.java Removed: hardcoded ip/port. Changed: SENSOR_COMPASS to match the name used in SensorSimulator project.SensorDemo.java Changed: startActivity to startActivityForResult, since I needed to be able to change IP/PORT prior to connecting. OI FM: Added primitive support for thumbnails. After loading the contents of adirectory, a separate thread will go through each file and try to load it as abitmap (scaled down to fit a predetermined thumbnail size).Could use more polishing; there needs to be more padding, and it would be niceif the images were cached.KEEP IN MIND that the debugger's exception handling causes memory leaks, sohandling too many bitmaps with the debugger attached can cause OOM failures.This is a debugger-only problem. Since the thumbnail loader scales the imagesdown while loading them, it is typically still possible to have prolongeddebugging sessions. Modified : /trunk/FileManager/src/org/openintents/filemanager/FileManagerActivity.java Added : /trunk/FileManager/src/org/openintents/filemanager/ThumbnailLoader.java

OI Safe: large patch, added Search activty, completely redid autolock,added preference 'Lock on screen lock' with default of true.autlock is no longer dependent upon CategoryList, which if notactive would cause app to go unlocked.  Instead each and everyactivity listens for the broadcast from the service to know toautolock.  None of the activities finish() upon lock but insteadlaunch FrontDoor to present user with AskPassword.  Upon unlockthe user is dropped right back where they left off.Started using Android 1.5 features like onUserInteraction() which allowsthe user to do anything with the app and cause a reset of the timer.OI Safe now requires 1.5 as a result.
